Description: Several fragments of a dark brown, red and natural coloured, woven wool wrapping, fabric type F. The spinning direction of the warp and weft is 's' and the weave is plain and and weft-faced. The thread count is 10 warp and 30-34 weft. The selvedge is reinforced with 3 cords and triangular in cross-section. The threads are 2 's'-spun and 'z' plied. A neat seam joins two red bands and there is a hem at the edge of one natural coloured band. All bands are c. 100mm wide. A detached wooden pin is preserved.
Bibliographic references: Adams et al 1999 / Kulubnarti III: The Cemeteries (p.62)
Condition: The dark brown weft bands have deteriorated and the warps are preserved but bare in places.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Dr William Yewdale Adams
Donated by: W S Webb Museum of Anthropology (University of Kentucky)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: 93.1. 191 (excavation object cat. no.)
